description: The provision of sector lights for the Canadian Coast Guard.
full_summary:
**Navigation Sector Lights Tender Announcement**
=============================================

Reference Number: WS4373761176-Document 4374663227

**Introduction**
---------------

The Minister of Public Works and Government Services, on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canadian Coast Guard in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, invites qualified suppliers to submit proposals for the supply and delivery of sector lights. The acquisition aims to meet the needs of the Canadian Coast Guard for navigation aids.

**Background**
-------------

The Canadian Coast Guard is responsible for ensuring safe navigation and the protection of the marine environment in Canadian waters. To achieve this goal, a reliable and efficient system of aids to navigation is essential.

**Objectives**
--------------

The procurement aims to acquire:

* Three (3) LED sector lights with navigation capabilities.
* The option to acquire six (6) additional sector lights at any time between the contract award date and August 30, 2026.

**Procurement Information**
-------------------------

* Solicitation Number: WS4373761176
* Amendment Number: 2
* Publication Date: January 2, 2024
* Tender Closing Date: February 14, 2024, at 14:00 hours (Eastern Standard Time)
* Expected Contract Start Date: April 15, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: **No limit**

**Selection Criteria**
----------------------

The selection criteria for this procurement is based on the lowest price.

**Trade Agreements**
-------------------

The procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)

**Regions of Opportunity**
-------------------------

The service provider must be willing to supply the goods from a location in Nova Scotia.

**Points of Contact**
---------------------

* Lisa Martin (SPAC/PSPC): [lisa.m.martin@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:lisa.m.martin@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
